questions.question_text: How can government laws and regulations result in economic risk?

options.A: They can make businesses less safe.
options.B: They can reduce a business's profits.
options.D: They can result in environmental problems.

questions.question_text: Which of the following is an important factor that affects the legal procedure:

options.B: Freedom

questions.question_text: A primary responsibility of administrative law is to

options.B: enforce agency regulations.

questions.question_text:
The Tafoya Company has discovered that the Bremen Company illegally used Tafoya's trademark. To 
pursue a legal case for financial compensation, what should Tafoya's legal counsel do first?

options.A:
Conduct an examination of discovery to interview all parties involved in the illegal use of the 
Tafoya trademark.
options.B:
File a formal complaint to the court alleging the Bremen Company's illegal use of the Tafoya 
trademark.
options.C:
Issue a summons requiring the Bremen Company to respond to allegations of misusing the 
trademark.
options.D: Request that a pretrial conference date be set to clarify all the legal issues that will be discussed

questions.question_text: Which of the following statements about the impact of law on business is accurate:

options.A: Businesses are governed by law at the local, national, and international levels.
options.B: Businesses are not governed by criminal law because it only applies to individuals.
options.C: Businesses should focus on corporate laws enacted and enforced by their local government.
options.D: Businesses should focus on ethical rather than legal issues required by national law.

questions.question_text:
Shawn is preparing for an interview with a local company. He knows that he should ask relevant 
questions about the job at the end of the interview. Which of the following will help him prepare these 
questions:

options.A: Conducting research about the company prior to the interview
options.B: Relying on the interviewer to generate the questions
options.C: Asking his friends what questions they think he should ask
options.D: Finding background information about the interviewer's high school and asking him/her about

questions.question_text:
Edith wants to organize the information in her persuasive paper in a clear, logical way that's easy for 
readers to understand. She starts by stating the dilemma at hand and then explains the answer that she 
believes will solve the dilemma. Which method of organizing information is Edith using?

options.B: Problem/Solution

questions.question_text: The part of a business letter that follows the inside address is the

options.B: signature line.

questions.question_text: Why is it important for businesses to include logical evidence in a persuasive letter?

options.A: To force the recipient to respond
options.B: To present interesting information
options.C: To explain the idea in strong language
options.D: To make the message more convincing

questions.question_text:
When analytical reports contain information that readers might disagree with, writers should back their 
conclusions with

options.B: technical statistics.

questions.question_text:
A message from the company president to all employees concerning a change in insurance coverage is 
a form of __________ communication.

options.B: informal

questions.question_text:
Every Friday, Odessa is supposed to remind employees to complete and sign their time sheets before 
going home for the weekend. What is the most appropriate channel for Odessa's reminder to 
employees?

options.B: Fax

questions.question_text:
Your friend Maureen is nervous about an upcoming staff meeting at her company. Since you have a lot of 
experience attending and participating in meetings, she asks you for advice. You tell her that she should 
be sure to

options.A: think about what she will say while others are speaking.
options.B: take the opportunity to bring up unrelated concerns she has.
options.C: keep quiet if she disagrees with someone else's point.
options.D: listen and look interested when someone is speaking.

questions.question_text:
Employees who always keep their commitments to customers are building positive relationships with 
those customers by being

options.B: assertive.

questions.question_text:
Oliver is an American businessperson who will be traveling to Scotland to close an important business 
deal. Does Oliver need to alter his communication style to adapt to the Scottish culture?

options.A:
No. Scottish people speak English, so Oliver does not need to do anything special to prepare for 
the trip.
options.B:
Yes. Scottish people tend to dislike Americans for many reasons, so Oliver needs to make sure 
he is behaving appropriately.
options.C:
Yes. Oliver should do some research on Scottish culture so he doesn't do or say something 
offensive.
options.D: No. Western cultures tend to have similar cultural attitudes and practices, so Oliver does not

questions.question_text: How does solving difficult-customer situations benefit you personally?

options.A: You will encounter difficult customers less frequently.
options.B: You gain valuable communication skills.
options.D: Your boss will automatically give you a raise.

questions.question_text: Which of the following situations involves finding another source of a limited natural resource:

options.A: Conserving the oil that we use
options.B: Searching for oil on the ocean floor
options.C: Paying a higher price for oil

questions.question_text: What role does utility play in the implementation of the marketing concept?

options.B: A satisfaction gauge

questions.question_text: Which of the following actions describes proactive management:

options.B: Making only long-term plans

questions.question_text: Which of the following is not one of the four main idealized market structures used in trade theory:

options.B: Perfect competition

questions.question_text: Government provides protection to business owners' property through the use of

options.B: minimum-wage laws.

questions.question_text:
An individual with a higher income who pays a larger percentage of his/her income as taxes than an 
individual with a lower income is in a __________ tax system.

options.B: regressive

questions.question_text: Limited commodities can cause

options.B: cost-push inflation.

questions.question_text: Some figures that are used to calculate the gross domestic product are

options.B: forecasts.

questions.question_text: When your self-concept is high, you usually believe that you are a(n) __________ person.

options.B: unimportant

questions.question_text: When you make a mistake, the responsible thing to do is

options.A: try to fix it before anyone finds out.
options.B: quit the project.
options.C: determine where to lay the blame.

questions.question_text:
When you are evaluated by your immediate supervisor, and s/he tells you of all the things you can do to 
improve your job performance, that is an example of

options.B: constructive criticism.

questions.question_text: People who receive a great deal of negative feedback may develop

options.B: enthusiasm.

questions.question_text:
A group of employees doing research and preparing a report to recommend that the business change 
certain policies is an example of using

options.B: leadership.

questions.question_text: Employees who set realistic goals and standards for themselves often are able to control their

options.B: level of stress.

questions.question_text: Maintaining a sense of humor can help you to be a good team member because it

options.B: helps to ease any tension that arises.

questions.question_text: How does a goal differ from a vision?

options.A: There is no difference—the two are the same.
options.B: A goal could mean different things to different people.
options.C: A goal is abstract and indefinite.
options.D: A goal is concrete and measurable.

questions.question_text: What is the most likely result when sexual harassment occurs in the workplace?

options.B: Motivation for employees to work harder

questions.question_text: Which of the following businesses is the best example of an entrepreneurial venture:

options.A: A juice bar decides to purchase trucks to sell juice on location during special events.
options.B: A veterinarian invents and sells a device to prevent horse water troughs from freezing.
options.C: A pumpkin farm offers pumpkin carving and costume contests to create more interest.
options.D: A bakery creates a "cretzel," a cross between a crescent and a pretzel, as a new product.

questions.question_text: Finance charges are expressed as a(n)

options.B: monthly percentage rate.

questions.question_text:
Who is legally responsible for repaying a bank loan if the loan borrower fails to make payments as 
indicated in the loan contract?

options.B: Credit union

questions.question_text:
Fiona made a $500 donation to a local homeless shelter last year. When she prepares her personal 
income tax form, she can claim the donation as part of her

options.B: tax deductions.

questions.question_text: For financial information to be reliable, it must also be

options.B: complete.

questions.question_text:
Mr. Gates owns two successful businesses and would like to open a third. Which of the following 
business activities should he consider first:

options.B: Accounting

questions.question_text: Which of the following is a factor that might cause a business to adjust its budget figures:

options.B: Economic trends

questions.question_text:
Which of the following airlines is most likely to be undervalued, based on their price-to-cash flow ratios: 
 
Sky High 
Current Stock Price: $14.36 
Cash Flow per Share: $5.21 
 
Smooth Flying 
Current Stock Price: $22.78 
Cash Flow per Share: $4.12 
 
Soar the Sky 
Current Stock Price: $18.50 
Cash Flow per Share: $3.59 
 
White Clouds 
Current Stock Price: $25.81 
Cash Flow per Share: $6.94

options.B: Sky High

questions.question_text: What is an indicator of strong organizational ethics?

options.B: Overpromising

questions.question_text: Which of the following is an ethical issue that relates to knowledge management in the workplace:

options.A:
The sales manager of a manufacturing firm shares the firm's quarterly sales goals with the sales 
staff.
options.B: A project leader requests that each member of his/her team provide a status report to the group.
options.C:
The president of a small company asks her/his executive team for input regarding a business 
decision.
options.D: An employee deliberately doesn't share information with management that will help the company

questions.question_text:
The FMT Company wants to implement a software program to capture and communicate tacit 
knowledge. Which of the following software applications is best suited to fulfill the company's needs:

options.B: Spreadsheet

questions.question_text: Which of the following is an action that threatens a company's ability to maintain its trade secrets:

options.B: Systematic neutralizing

questions.question_text: Which of the following is a true statement about company goals:

options.A: They can't be accomplished without employees' dedication.
options.B: They are the same at every company.
options.D: They are important only for new companies.

questions.question_text: “Helsinki is the capital of Finland” is an example of what type of information?

options.B: Opinion

questions.question_text:
So the company can make wise business decisions, it is important for the company to effectively manage 
its

options.B: ratings.

questions.question_text:
By searching the company's computer records, an employee obtained confidential information about a 
well-known client, which s/he discussed with a friend. Eventually, the information was leaked to the 
media, which embarrassed the client and the business. What action could the company have taken to 
prevent this unethical behavior?

options.B: Install anti-virus software to protect the computer network
options.C: Use computer passwords to limit access to certain data
options.D: Require the employee to submit his/her resignation

questions.question_text: What technological component manages the computer's software and hardware?

options.B: Power supply

questions.question_text:
Bobbi is searching the Internet for information about business licenses. Unfortunately, many of the 
search results are useless to her because they focus on drivers' licenses. What search terms should 
Bobbi use to find information specifically about business licenses?

options.B: +business +license

questions.question_text:
Holly, Cary, and Rick are working on a project together, even though they are geographically far away 
from each other. They use the Internet to work on documents together, share files, and communicate 
quickly and easily. What type of software are Holly, Cary, and Rick using?

options.B: Shareware

questions.question_text: One limitation of project-management software is that it lacks the ability to

options.B: generate reports.

questions.question_text:
A company has decided to move its important information into a new digital database. Immediately after 
moving its data, what should the company do?

options.A: Send out a press release to the public about the data migration.
options.B: Check to make sure that no data were lost in the moving process.
options.C: Hold a company-wide meeting to discuss the database change.
options.D: Train employees on the importance of safe data-migration practices.

questions.question_text: When an existing customer's contact information changes, what should a company do?

options.A: Add the customer's record in the employee directory
options.B: Create a new record that contains the customer's changes
options.C: Update the customer's record in the company database
options.D: Enter the customer's contact information in a new database

questions.question_text: Running out of inventory can result in

options.B: lost sales.

questions.question_text:
Which of the following facility components are inspected by authorized officials to ensure that safety 
ordinances are met:

options.B: Photocopiers

questions.question_text:
It is important for businesses to provide employees with safety and health information and training in 
order to

options.B: ensure greater profits.

questions.question_text: Which of the following activities should be an employee's top priority:

options.A:
Making reservations at a local restaurant for a business luncheon that is going to be held in two 
weeks
options.B: Preparing a purchase order that needs to be faxed to the vendor in two days
options.C:
Completing a status report that takes 45 minutes to prepare for a meeting that will occur in an 
hour
options.D: Photocopying a three-page document for a meeting with a customer that is scheduled to occur

questions.question_text:
Robert forgot that he told Sabrina to update the price list, so he asked Todd to do it. Due to the lack of 
coordination among the team members, what is most likely to happen?

options.B: Duplicate work

questions.question_text: When proposing delegated tasks to her team, Becca asked for feedback so that she could

options.B: promote her authority.

questions.question_text: Which of the following is a true statement about projects:

options.B: They rely on traditional management structures.
options.D: Their processes are more important than their results.

questions.question_text: A useful communications strategy in project planning is

options.A: determining how much funding the project will take.
options.B: assigning responsibility for meeting quality requirements.
options.C: asking yourself how long each deliverable will take to complete.
options.D: grouping team members according to type and level of information.

questions.question_text: What is required of businesses to maintain positive, long-term relationships with their suppliers?

options.B: Flexible lead times

questions.question_text:
Which of the following is an example of an item that most likely requires a retailer to place a special order 
with a manufacturer:

options.B: Windshield wipers for a 2008 Honda Accord
options.C: A cellphone charger for a popular smartphone
options.D: A color ink cartridge for a computer printer

questions.question_text: Which of the following are examples of raw materials that a business might keep on hand for production:

options.A: Oil, grain, shoes, and household cleanser
options.B: Leather, bolts, stapler, and ore

questions.question_text:
Because the ILM Manufacturing Company orders large amounts of bolts and washers, the company's 
buyer asks its parts vendor for an additional five percent off the invoice total. This is an example of a 
business negotiating

options.B: a quantity discount.

questions.question_text:
Production processes that rely heavily on expensive equipment and materials are __________ 
processes.

options.B: labor-intensive

questions.question_text:
Which of the following quality-control tools is a graphical representation of two variables that is used to 
determine cause and effect:

options.B: Histogram

questions.question_text: Which of the following best describes a goal of effective supply chain management:

options.B: Reducing inventory

questions.question_text:
When employees review and analyze financial reports and income data from different time frames, they 
are

options.B: comparing data.

questions.question_text:
A manufacturing company is required by the local government to dispose of its waste in an 
environmentally safe way. This is an example of how process design can be affected by __________ 
factors.

options.B: regulatory

questions.question_text: Technology impacts just-in-time inventory management by

options.B: eliminating the need for supplier relationships.
options.C: causing disruptions in the supply chain.
options.D: allowing inventory to be monitored regularly.

questions.question_text: Which of the following is a strategy to help manage risks in a global supply chain:

options.B: Hire only local workers
options.C: Work only within the same time zone

questions.question_text: To protect customer data such as credit card information, businesses should

options.A: use a shared server to store information.
options.B: accept payments in cash only.
options.C: require that all customers show an I

questions.question_text: When you keep your workspace organized, you are less likely to

options.B: misplace important documents.

questions.question_text: Which of the following statements is true of time management:

options.A: It is a matter of common sense and just involves using a calendar.
options.B: It refers to how people use the 24 hours in their day.
options.C: It requires a significant amount of extra work.
options.D: It makes it more difficult for you to plan for the future.

questions.question_text:
Even when times are tough for Caitlin's business venture, she tends to remain positive—she looks at the 
glass as half full rather than half empty. What characteristic of entrepreneurship is Caitlin exhibiting?

options.B: Organization

questions.question_text: Department manager, small business manager, and regional manager are __________ positions.

options.B: business analytics

questions.question_text: What is often the first step in conducting a job search?

options.B: Completing applications

questions.question_text:
Is it ever appropriate for an individual looking for a job to send a letter of application to a business that 
has not advertised a job opening?

options.A: No, the business will discard the letter if it has no openings.
options.B: Yes, the worker should write to each business in the industry.
options.C: Yes, the worker can write if s/he has heard about a job opening.
options.D: No, a letter is used only in response to job advertisements.

questions.question_text:
To perform his job, Andrew works with a complex database program. Recently, a new version of the 
database program that he uses was released. The new program is more powerful, efficient, and user 
friendly. To learn how to use the program effectively, Andrew signed up to take a class at the community 
college. In this situation, Andrew is continuing his education so that he can

options.B: change his career path.

questions.question_text: What is a primary advantage of developing a work breakdown structure (WBS) to manage large projects?

options.B: Prevents the duplication of work
options.C: Reduces the need to set project milestones
options.D: Decreases the need to manage each task

questions.question_text:
A project manager has determined that the team completed the software-development phase of the 
project four days ahead of schedule. What control activity is the project manager performing?

options.B: Tracking a milestone

questions.question_text:
When team members disagree about the best way to complete an activity, the project manager may 
need to

options.B: negotiate with external sources.

questions.question_text:
Releasing equipment, materials, and team members are tasks that are completed during the 
___________ phase of a project.

options.B: scheduling

questions.question_text: The overall purpose of the Six Sigma quality-management framework is to satisfy customers and

options.B: simplify activities.

questions.question_text: What step in the continuous improvement process will indicate if quality is increasing?

options.B: Evaluation

questions.question_text: A business risks losing its good reputation if it

options.A: requires new suppliers to provide credit information.
options.B: provides accurate information to stockholders.
options.C: encourages employees to report questionable behavior.
options.D: uses questionable tactics to achieve profitability.

questions.question_text:
To reduce the risk of unauthorized access to confidential data, businesses use security software to 
protect their

options.B: intranet systems.

questions.question_text:
When businesses continuously monitor the laws and implement changes to remain in compliance, they 
are

options.B: demonstrating negligence.

questions.question_text:
When managers have the ability to understand how all of the functions of the company are interrelated, 
they possess

options.B: interpersonal skills.

questions.question_text: What must occur before any management functions can be carried out?

options.B: Planning

questions.question_text: The organizing function of management is important to a business because it

options.B: ensures efficient performance levels.

questions.question_text: Which of the following is a true statement about human resources needs:

options.A: They are harder to meet in high-tech industries.
options.B: They are always changing.
options.C: They are the same at every business.
options.D: There is no way to know when they will change.

questions.question_text: What management function involves motivating and encouraging an employee?

options.B: Directing

questions.question_text: Measuring the productivity of a business's employees is an example of

options.B: formal authority.

questions.question_text: Which of the following employees would most likely be described as “innovative” by his/her supervisor:

options.A: Elizabeth, because she gets frustrated when she needs to learn new skills
options.B: Madison, because she prefers to stick to traditional ideas and processes
options.C: Jake, because he is always willing to adapt to changes during a project
options.D: Anthony, because he is usually quiet during brainstorming sessions

questions.question_text:
Frederic used to own the only pizza place in town—until a new place opened up. Even though Frederic's 
never been to the new pizza place, he tells everyone he meets that the new place uses inferior 
ingredients and has been investigated by the health department. He even leaves negative reviews of the 
pizza place online. Which business tort do Frederic's actions fall under?

options.B: Unfair competition

questions.question_text: When entering into a contract with another business, an agent is the party that represents the

options.B: defendant.

questions.question_text: The person who files a lawsuit is the

options.B: defendant.

questions.question_text: Why might parties choose to use mediation to solve a dispute?

options.B: To spend more money
options.D: To get a less personal result

questions.question_text:
Sasha's science teacher is explaining lab directions to the class. They'll be performing a complicated 
experiment with many steps that will take about a week. The next day, Sasha tries to remember a step of 
the directions, but she can't. Which step of following oral directions should Sasha have followed?

options.B: Take notes

questions.question_text:
"This is an exciting new opportunity for you," says Jane's boss. Which of the following nonverbal cues 
would appropriately reinforce that message?

options.B: Slouching

questions.question_text:
Jolie is working in a group in her business class. If she wants to contribute to her group's discussion in a 
meaningful way, what should she do?

options.A: Summarize what's been discussed in the conversation
options.B: Let someone know right away if his/her idea is bad or unrealistic
options.C: Wait for other people to lead the conversation when it gets silent
options.D: Ask questions as a way of judging someone else's suggestion

questions.question_text: What are the three main purposes of oral presentations?

options.B: To inform, persuade, and entertain

questions.question_text:
Aaron prepared a detailed report for his supervisor that described several issues that Aaron's work group 
has been experiencing with a long-term project. Aaron described the most difficult or challenging issues 
in the beginning of the report and ended the report with the least important points. How did Aaron 
organize the information in the report?

options.B: Alphabetical by category

questions.question_text:
Jacob is determining the writing style to use for an analytical report. If most readers are likely to support 
the report's content, Jacob should format the report for a(n) __________ audience.

options.B: indecisive

questions.question_text: Which of the following is the last component of a research report:

options.B: Purpose of the study

questions.question_text:
Phoebe is the manager of a small company. One of her employees has been showing up late and 
missing work frequently. What channel of communication should Phoebe use to discuss this issue with 
him?

options.B: An email message

questions.question_text: When participating in a project-status meeting, it is important for a participant to

options.A: be prepared to provide an update.
options.B: monopolize the conversation.
options.C: provide information about new company policies.

questions.question_text:
A customer asks Roger a question about a product, and he isn't sure of the correct answer. He 
immediately phones his supervisor to get the needed information. Which technique for building positive 
customer relations does this illustrate?

options.B: Keep your promises.

questions.question_text: Today, customer relationship management is considered an important tool in

options.B: business decision-making.

questions.question_text: Which of the following is an economic service:

options.B: Bottle of perfume

questions.question_text: Which of the following are examples of capital goods:

options.B: Bull dozers, photocopiers, and roads

questions.question_text: One reason that businesses use a matrix organizational design is to

options.B: improve employee productivity.

questions.question_text:
Which of the following is an example of a government regulation that affects a business's working 
conditions:

options.B: Food inspection

questions.question_text: Which of the following is an item that is subject to an excise tax:

options.B: Carton of eggs

questions.question_text: A company is facing negative returns. Which stage of production is the company in?

options.B: Third

questions.question_text: Which of the following is a true statement about gross domestic product (GDP):

options.A: Improved use of resources increases the GDP.
options.B: The underground economy overstates the GDP.
options.C: It is easy to measure the GDP accurately.
options.D: A decrease in GDP results in a higher standard of living.

questions.question_text: Which of the following illustrates the impact of a country's history on world trade:

options.A: Countries with widely different religious beliefs have difficulty establishing trust.
options.B: Countries that have engaged in war conflicts have difficulty establishing trust.
options.C: Countries speaking different languages have difficulty understanding each other.
options.D: Countries that are adjacent to each other have more opportunities for conflict.

questions.question_text: One good way to raise your level of self-esteem when it has dropped is to

options.A: discuss your feelings with someone you trust.
options.B: withdraw from activities for a while.

questions.question_text:
Workers can demonstrate their honesty and integrity by giving a fair amount of ___________ for their 
pay.

options.B: concern

questions.question_text:
For two hours a day, Jacob shuts his office door to prevent interruptions, does not check email, and does 
not accept incoming phone calls. This enables Jacob to focus on his most important tasks. What 
technique is Jacob using to help him manage his work commitments effectively?

options.A: Eliminating the use of technological tools
options.B: Delegating his workload

questions.question_text: How does having a sense of humor help you maintain a positive attitude?

options.A: It encourages you to give your appearance the attention it deserves.
options.B: If you hang out with positive people, you'll be positive as well.
options.C: It is easier to maintain a positive attitude when you're healthy.
options.D: It keeps you from taking yourself too seriously.

questions.question_text: When people make you angry or upset, you may be able to maintain your self-control if you

options.B: use language to vent your anger.
options.D: make an effort to remain calm.

questions.question_text: Which of the following is an internal source of feedback:

options.B: Yourself

questions.question_text: Which of the following is an example of violating a coworker's privacy in the workplace:

options.A: Thomas changed the wording on Carrie's report with her approval.
options.B: Ruby saw that her coworkers were having a serious discussion, so she walked away.
options.C: Joe needed a pen, so he opened Ali's desk drawer to look for one while she was away.
options.D: Paige sent a personal email from her work computer to her friend Alan.

questions.question_text: Which of the following is a true statement about secondary dimensions of diversity:

options.B: They are physical traits.
options.C: They are determined by a person's subculture.

questions.question_text:
During a staff meeting, Matthew says, "In closing, I want to congratulate Shelby, who has been 
instrumental in landing the Feldman account. This account has the potential to greatly impact our 
company's sales." Matthew is motivating an employee by

options.A: providing her with a monetary reward.
options.B: acknowledging her efforts.

questions.question_text:
Frank has a good understanding of his own emotions. What component of emotional intelligence does 
Frank demonstrate?

options.B: Self-management

questions.question_text:
Collaborative relationships with colleagues from other departments are beneficial to the business 
because they often

options.B: prevent workplace conflict.

questions.question_text:
John recently expanded his business into another country to reach more of his target market. He was 
initially thrilled with his company's profits following the expansion—until he converted the money back to 
his domestic currency. At that point, he realized that the company made much less than he originally 
thought. What risk involved with international business did John experience?

options.B: Foreign exchange rate fluctuations
options.D: The cost of international unionized labor

questions.question_text: Which of the following is a disadvantage of a checking account:

options.B: Direct payroll deposit

questions.question_text: What financial concept does this scenario illustrate?

options.B: Dividend reinvestment plan

questions.question_text: Incorrect information on an individual's credit report may hinder his/her ability to

options.B: withdraw money from a savings account.

questions.question_text: How do businesses transfer risk?

options.B: Implement security measures

questions.question_text:
Emma is reviewing the sales budget in relation to the actual sales generated for a set time frame. How is 
Emma using financial information in this situation?

options.A: To compare estimated performance with actual performance
options.B: To establish new quality standards and benchmarks
options.D: To analyze the impact of aging accounts

questions.question_text:
When preparing her company's budget, Tatiana's manager told her that the company would be merging 
with another company. To maintain her ethics, Tatiana should

options.A: report this information to the SEC.
options.B: make sure the merger benefits the public interest.

questions.question_text: Which of the following are listed as long-term assets on a balance sheet:

options.B: Land, cash, and mortgage

questions.question_text: What was the company's free cash flow?
Which of the following business trends affects human resources management:

options.B: Costs of business going down

questions.question_text: Which of the following is an example of receiving tacit knowledge:

options.A: "Shadowing" a person in your desired career
options.B: Reading a history textbook

questions.question_text:
Bailey knows that she has more knowledge about digital marketing than anyone else on her team. She is 
reluctant to share her knowledge because she wants to give herself an advantage. This is an example of 
how

options.B: it is impossible to get ahead in your career if you share knowledge.
options.D: self-interest can prevent effective knowledge management.

questions.question_text:
Corsica Steel Mill has developed a new process to reduce the time it takes to complete a phase of 
production. To legally protect this new process from unauthorized use, the company should obtain a

options.B: copyright.

questions.question_text:
Seth recently informed his manager, Tammy, that he is leaving the company. During her last meeting 
with Seth, Tammy took detailed notes and asked Seth questions about the problems that Seth had 
encountered on the job and how he handled them. Seth shared important information that his 
replacement will need to know so s/he can do the job efficiently. What technique is Tammy using to 
capture knowledge for future use in the organization?

options.B: Exit interview

questions.question_text: Which of the following factors has the greatest effect on a consumer's buying behavior:

options.B: Situational influences

questions.question_text:
Which of the following is an ethical dilemma related to an employee providing information in the 
workplace:

options.A:
A customer asks Kate to mail a complete product catalog and a comprehensive price list to 
his/her business.
options.B:
Bob's new employer asks him to share confidential information about product-development 
processes that his previous employer uses.
options.C: Melinda and two of her coworkers talk about their plans to work overtime next weekend.
options.D: Steven advises a customer that Simpson Electronics does not provide personal information to

questions.question_text: Any business storing customers' personal banking account information is legally required to

options.A: maintain the confidentiality of the stored information.
options.B: share the information with its competitors.
options.C: provide the information to the government for tax purposes.
options.D: provide affiliated banks access to the information.

questions.question_text: What technological component manages the computer's software and hardware?

options.B: Power supply

questions.question_text: Which of the following is a characteristic common to all integrated software packages:

options.B: Calculates break-even points

questions.question_text:
Which component of project-management software helps project managers determine the length of time 
that a series of interdependent tasks will take to complete under various circumstances:

options.B: Critical path

questions.question_text: A business is mostly likely to review customer invoices from the previous year to

options.B: evaluate ideas.

questions.question_text:
Maxton Mart is being pressured by its vendors to pay for inventory it purchased more than 30 days ago. 
However, Maxton Mart has not received its accounts receivable from customers. What business record 
has Maxton Mart failed to monitor successfully?

options.B: Income statement

A trend currently impacting the business environment is the increased number of fathers who are directly 
involved in care giving for their children. This trend represents a change in

options.B: demographics.

questions.question_text: The owner of a business facility that has hazardous electrical wiring is likely to be fined for violating

options.B: federal trade laws.

questions.question_text: Which of the following is an example of employee pilferage:

options.A: Hacking into a competitor's computer network to obtain trade secrets
options.B: Changing the amount specified on a check you prepare for the company with authorization
options.C: Installing personally owned software on your workplace computer

questions.question_text:
Lily is the last employee to leave the building today. To reduce the risk of theft, Lily should __________ 
before she __________.

options.A: set the security alarm; locks the doors
options.B: turn off the lights; sets the security alarm
options.C: turn on the surveillance camera; adjusts the thermostat
options.D: adjust the thermostat; turns on the surveillance camera

questions.question_text: Which of the following is the most important factor to consider when prioritizing work tasks:

options.B: Due dates of tasks

questions.question_text: When delegating work to their employees, managers should make sure to clearly articulate their

options.A: preference for quantity of work over quality.
options.B: rules and consequences for breaking them.
options.C: punishment for staff that fail to meet the deadline.

questions.question_text: What the project will and will not include is called the

options.B: scope.

questions.question_text:
Determining which tasks need to be performed and when they need to be completed is an important 
aspect of project

options.B: initiating.

questions.question_text: Which of the following do purchasing personnel try to obtain, along with the lowest possible price:

options.B: Loyalty

questions.question_text:
When companies work with their vendors to develop mutually beneficial business arrangements, they are 
more likely to

options.B: maintain long-term relationships.

questions.question_text: What is most likely to happen if a purchaser negotiates lower prices for raw materials?

options.A: The company will be limited in which type of materials can be purchased.
options.B: The company will be able to purchase more materials and increase production.
options.C: Increases in productivity will lead to higher costs.

questions.question_text: When is a business most likely to place a straight reorder with a vendor?

options.B: To accommodate customers' unique requests
options.D: To change the quantities of items that it routinely orders

questions.question_text: Why does a business keep stock on hand for resale?

options.A: So it can buy raw materials
options.B: So it can produce manufactured goods
options.C: To use it in business operations
options.D: To sell it to end users

questions.question_text: What should businesses do before negotiating with vendors?

options.B: Implement aggressive tactics

questions.question_text: Acceptance sampling is a part of statistical quality control that involves

options.A: identifying the cause of quality problems.
options.B: filling out control charts.
options.C: determining whether to approve or reject an entire batch of products.
options.D: painting a picture with descriptive statistics.

questions.question_text:
Mitchell is reviewing internal data and proposals from several agencies to determine the best course of 
action for implementing a major advertising campaign for his company. What is Mitchell analyzing?

options.B: Operating schedule

questions.question_text:
An Internet and cable provider is considering whether to implement a new process that would require its 
customer service agents to work the phone lines for 24 hours a day instead of the previous 12 hours a 
day. What type of factor will most likely impact the design of this new process?

options.B: Regulatory

questions.question_text: Technology impacts just-in-time inventory management by

options.B: eliminating the need for supplier relationships.
options.C: causing disruptions in the supply chain.
options.D: allowing inventory to be monitored regularly.

questions.question_text: Supply chain networks encompass the flow and movement of __________ among __________.

options.B: employees and customers; governments

questions.question_text:
An American car manufacturer exports many of its automobiles to Asia. A recent delivery to China was 
detained at Chinese customs due to a miscommunication between the English-speaking barge operator 
and the Mandarin-speaking shipyard receiver. This is an example of which of the following global supply 
chain issues:

options.B: Accountability and compliance

questions.question_text: How can a company hold employees accountable for protecting digital assets?

options.B: An effective laptop security policy

questions.question_text:
Riley is working with a design firm on a promotional campaign. The designer gives her a USB drive with 
some possible layouts to review. To ensure she is protecting the customer data on her computer, Riley 
should

options.B: refuse to open the files.
options.C: delete customer information before opening it.
options.D: scan the drive for viruses before opening it.

questions.question_text:
When it gets noisy in her workspace, Olivia puts on her headphones and listens to soft music while she 
works. What principle of time management is Olivia following?

options.A: Dividing large projects into smaller parts
options.B: Knowing how she works best
options.C: Making the most of her down time
options.D: Focusing on personal goals rather than work tasks

questions.question_text: Which of the following is an example of an employee who is meeting his/her employer's expectations:

options.A: Tom spends the first half hour of the workday chatting with Kate.
options.B: Allison focuses on her work tasks so she can meet her deadlines.
options.C: Rachel sends a text message to her roommate during a meeting.
options.D: Calvin tells a customer about his issues with a difficult coworker.

questions.question_text:
Cameron supervises the transportation, storage, and handling of his company's products. Which type of 
business management and administration career does Cameron have?

options.B: Business analytics

questions.question_text:
What would be the best response to write on a job application form for the reason that you left your last 
job if you quit because you felt your supervisor was unfair?

options.A: Unable to get along with supervisor
options.B: Left for a better job

questions.question_text:
Last week, Marcus attended a friend's birthday party and talked with Lynnette, a manager with the 
Trendall and Young accounting firm. Marcus mentioned that he is a technology major and will be looking 
for a job after he graduates in June. Lynnette gave Marcus her business card, and told him that her firm 
might be hiring during the summer months. The interaction between Marcus and Lynnette is an example 
of

options.B: professional networking.

questions.question_text: An organization's product goals often involve setting standards for

options.A: the variety of its goods and services.
options.B: behavior in the workplace.

questions.question_text: Which of the following is the sequential order of a project's work breakdown structure:

options.B: Work assignment, task, and subtask

questions.question_text:
Which of the following is a primary responsibility of the project manager during the execution phase of a 
project:

options.A: Developing a list of work tasks
options.B: Assembling a steering committee

questions.question_text: Which of the following is an example of a project manager motivating a project team:

options.A: Zoey sends an email requesting each team member provide her with a weekly activity report.
options.B:
Marcus tells Thomas that he might work more efficiently if he performed one task before another 
one.
options.C:
Ryan advises Samantha that she will need to perform additional duties while Maggie is on 
vacation.
options.D: Tamara recognizes how hard her team is working, so she provides lunch for the team members.

questions.question_text:
After providing the stakeholders with the project deliverables, Lisa analyzed and documented the 
project's actual results with the initial project goals. What did Lisa do?

options.B: Conduct a post-implementation review

questions.question_text:
A manufacturing company uses Six Sigma as a quality management framework. This means that the 
company

options.A: produces only 3.4 defects per million parts.
options.B: follows the plan-do-check-adjust approach.
options.C: uses an IT-oriented approach to quality management.
options.D: has created its own quality management framework.

questions.question_text: Which of the following is a potential benefit of implementing continuous quality improvement processes:

options.B: Lower productivity

questions.question_text:
Madelyn is responsible for selecting Elite Manufacturing Company's new payroll-processing vendor. 
Madelyn has narrowed down her selection to three vendors and is favoring Pay Day Enterprises, the 
small company where her brother works. The primary concern with Pay Day is that it has never handled 
payroll for a company as large as Elite, which presents a business risk to the manufacturing company. 
This situation illustrates an ethical issue related to

options.B: financial reporting methodology.

questions.question_text:
Using computer-data backup procedures on a regular basis reduces a company's level of risk because 
the process

options.B: prevents hackers from accessing the computer system.
options.C: saves information when computer failures occur.
options.D: allows employees to use many applications.

questions.question_text: What can a business do if it is exposed to risks that commercial insurance companies do not cover?

options.B: Acquire a professional association

questions.question_text:
Which of the following levels of managers spend most of their time staffing, directing, and controlling the 
day-to-day activities of the business:

options.B: First-line

questions.question_text: What is an advantage of managerial planning?

options.B: Eliminates errors
options.C: Decreases the need to delegate work
options.D: Lessens the need to monitor employees

questions.question_text: What management function is responsible for coordinating resources in ways that maximize efficiency?

options.B: Staffing

questions.question_text: Which task in the staffing process ensures that employees are knowledgeable and productive?

options.B: Recruiting

questions.question_text: A primary activity of the directing function of management is

options.B: identifying skills.

questions.question_text: A primary activity in managerial control is

options.B: delegating.

questions.question_text: What occurs during the first stage of the change-management life cycle?

options.A: Organizations carry out a strategic plan for implementing desired change.
options.B: Organizations engage in dialogue to determine how to best implement change.
options.C: Organizations agree on a strategic plan for implementing the desired change.
options.D: Organizations identify and communicate the need for change to employees.

questions.question_text:
To sell sweatshirts, jackets, and T-shirts imprinted with ABC University's logo, the Collegiate Sportswear
Company pays royalties to the university. What type of business ownership does this situation exemplify?

options.B: Licensing agreement

questions.question_text: Which of the following statements is true about the directing function of management:

options.B: It is results driven rather than performance driven.
options.D: It primarily occurs at the lowest level of the organization.

Legal ownership of purchases does not pass to the purchaser until all payments have been made if the
purchaser uses __________ credit.

options.B: trade

Belinda is reviewing departmental reports to determine why the business's outputs have been decreasing
steadily over the last six weeks. Belinda is analyzing issues related to

options.B: finance.

options.B: Credit report

While opening a large box of office supplies, Kendall accidentally cut her finger with the box cutters she was
using. Another employee, Jorge, was helping Kendall at the time and witnessed the accident. What is the first
thing that Jorge should do?

options.B: Put the office supplies away

questions.question_text:
Before filing a civil lawsuit in court, Kwame's attorney sent a letter to Tosh's attorney. In the letter, Kwame's 
attorney explained why they believe they would win a lawsuit against Tosh. Kwame's attorney sent a(n)

options.B: official

options.B: limited

A business captures its employees' knowledge of certain tasks, processes, and events by developing a chart 
that outlines the relationships among bits of information. This is an example of a business using a(n) 
__________ technique to capture and transfer knowledge.

options.B: authority-based

options.B: Operations manager

Supply chain network design improves service and reduces cost by aligning purchasing, production, 
warehousing, inventory, and

options.B: transportation.

Holly, Jamar, and Ricki are working on a project together, even though they are geographically far away from 
each other. They use the internet to work on documents together, share files, and communicate quickly and 
easily. What type of software are Holly, Jamar, and Ricki using?

options.B: Spyware

options.B: Body posture

If a business sells its customer list to other organizations without obtaining its customers' consent, the business 
is likely to

options.A: take legal action against the other organizations.
options.B: lose its customers' trust.
options.D: offer deep discounts to gain back its customers' loyalty.

Lamont Enterprises is using a trademark that looks very similar to the Seward Company's trademark. To 
prevent Lamont from continuing to use the trademark, Seward can take legal action by

options.B: charging Lamont with obstruction of justice.
options.C: filing an infringement lawsuit against Lamont.
options.D: requiring Lamont to pay a licensing fee.

questions.question_text:
Lisa and Aaliyah are finishing a school project together. When Lisa asks Aaliyah what she thinks about her half 
of the project, Aaliyah tells her, "That looks good, but let me show you what else you could have done." 
Aaliyah's comments are an example of

options.B: constructive criticism.

questions.question_text: To maintain positive, ongoing relationships with vendors, a business should

options.B: develop complex contracts.

questions.question_text: Online shipment tracking is one example of __________ affecting supply chain management.

options.B: technology

questions.question_text: Ethical quality management aims to benefit

options.A: the business and those outside it.
options.B: individuals in positions of power.
options.D: the business and its employees only.

questions.question_text: Which of the following are usually responsible for analyzing a business’s income statement:

options.B: Bookkeepers

options.B: playing favorites with them.
options.C: valuing their success over your own.
options.D: ignoring all of their flaws and mistakes.

options.A: They don't value an organizational culture of learning.
options.B: They know that new knowledge is only created outside the organization.
options.C: They want to ensure that organizational knowledge isn't wasted.
options.D: They must follow the laws and regulations of their industries.

example, businesses are required to keep their walkways and passageways free from obstruction and debris.

options.B: operations; accessibility

questions.question_text: Which of the following tasks is a project manager typically responsible for:

options.A: Determining and communicating the project objectives to clients
options.B: Telling project team members how to complete their activities
options.C: Providing direction and coordination to the project team work
options.D: Completing and documenting all of the necessary project work

questions.question_text: What function of management establishes a company's levels of authority?

options.B: Evaluating

questions.question_text: How can management reduce the business's level of risk associated with ethics?

options.A: Advise employees that following business ethics depends on the situation
options.B: Assume employees know what constitutes ethical behavior
options.C: Allow employees to follow their own set of ethics
options.D: Train employees about expectations in relation to workplace ethics

questions.question_text: Building and maintaining political relationships within an organization is often beneficial because it often

options.B: helps employees and the company accomplish objectives.
options.C: prevents the competition from losing market share.
options.D: reduces the need to seek information from outside sources.

questions.question_text:
Managers need to be familiar with the latest technology, government regulations, innovations and trends within 
the industry, and competitors' activities. What category of resource is this?

options.B: Information

questions.question_text: A developing country sets its currency to be the same value as the U.S. dollar. This is called a(n)

options.B: free-floating currency.

questions.question_text: What should you do if a customer is being difficult or demanding?

options.A: Ignore them, and focus on another customer.
options.B: Continue to treat them with courtesy and respect.
options.C: Promise to give the customer a significant discount.
options.D: Tell the customer that their attitude is inappropriate.

questions.question_text:
The PVX automotive manufacturer keeps office supplies such as copy paper, pens, and notepads on hand at all 
times. These office supplies are part of the manufacturer's inventory of

options.B: raw materials.

questions.question_text: When you are able to respect and appreciate other people's unique viewpoints, you can

options.A: work more efficiently at your job.
options.B: take on more responsibility at work.
options.D: expect people to take advantage of you.

questions.question_text: Ethical stakeholder management includes

options.B: communicating honestly and openly.

questions.question_text: Which of the following demonstrates business innovation:

options.B: Tessa introduces more sustainable packaging.
options.C: Myesha attends a creative design conference.
options.D: Xavi listens to a startup business podcast.

questions.question_text:
Kara is preparing the work breakdown structure (WBS) for a new project. She has prepared five work packages. 
She has estimated the time to complete each package as follows: Package A—26 hours; Package B—50 
hours; Package C—38 hours; Package D—6 hours; and Package E—15 hours. If Kara's estimates are 
accurate, has she followed the 8/80 rule?

options.A: Yes, the average time to complete each package is 27 hours, which meets the 8/80 criteria.
options.B: Yes, Kara has scheduled the packages so that each one does not exceed 80 hours.
options.C: No, package D does not meet the minimum requirement of taking eight hours to complete.
options.D: No, Kara has scheduled more than 80 hours of work for the entire project.

questions.question_text:
Which of the following helps individuals understand how their actions, needs, interests, values, and motives 
affect their personal behavior:

options.B: Self-fulfillment

questions.question_text: A request made by an employee to a supervisor is an example of what type of communication?

options.B: Grapevine

questions.question_text: Which of the following is the primary purpose of word processing software programs:

options.B: To arrange numerical data

questions.question_text: The person who files a lawsuit is the

options.B: lawyer.

questions.question_text:
Knowledge management is important for business success, but it is often limited by __________ team 
members.

options.B: collaborative

questions.question_text:
Vanessa is putting procedures into practice so her business records will not be lost in an office fire. She is 
practicing which tip of good recordkeeping?

options.B: Pick a style

questions.question_text: To continuously improve their quality processes, businesses need to

options.B: implement flexible policies.

questions.question_text:
A company develops a new production process so employees can create products while seated. This requires 
the company to schedule overtime hours but complies with a law that prevents employees from standing for 
more than eight hours. The company has changed its manufacturing process in response to

options.B: regulations.

questions.question_text:
Which of the following measures of central tendency is the most influenced by outliers at the extremes of a data 
set:

options.B: Mean

questions.question_text:
Lakshna is buying a new car. There is a vehicle she likes at Dealership A, but before she makes her purchase, 
Lakshna visits three other dealerships to look at similar vehicles to make sure she is getting the best deal. This 
is an example of

options.B: merchandising.

questions.question_text:
Mr. Williams's small pharmacy has been in operation for 10 years. Recently, a few senior citizens have asked to 
be billed once a month for medicines and other medical supplies. Mr. Williams would like to accommodate the 
seniors but is not sure of the effect these changes would have on his business. Which business activity would 
help Mr. Williams make a sound decision?

options.B: Marketing

questions.question_text: Which of the following is an example of a standing order:

options.A:
A department store's assistant buyer places an order with a clothing manufacturer for winter coats without 
providing specific styles, sizes, or colors.
options.B:
An electronics retailer places an order on July 15 for a popular smartphone upgrade that will be available on 
December 1.
options.C:
The Dunder Mifflin Paper Company ships 12 cases of copy paper to the KMV Company on the third 
Wednesday of every month.
options.D: Mr. and Ms. McPherson place an order with a local carpenter for a handcrafted table in a non-standard size.

questions.question_text: Having a “rainy day" fund equivalent to six months of living expenses is an important financial goal because

options.A: you can dip into your emergency fund to pay for things like vacations and clothing.
options.B: emergency funds guarantee that you will be okay even if you never work again.
options.C: it will protect you during a catastrophe, such as a health emergency or unemployment.
options.D: you won't need to save for college or retirement if you have an emergency fund.

questions.question_text:
Individuals and businesses who are sued have a legal right to present evidence on their behalf before a court 
can impose a penalty. In other words, these individuals and businesses have a right to

options.B: substantive due process.

questions.question_text: How does supply chain management increase customer satisfaction?

options.A: Reduces the time it takes for goods to reach consumers
options.B: Integrates information throughout an organization

questions.question_text: During which phase of a project do project team members perform archiving procedures?

options.B: Execution

questions.question_text: What is the primary purpose of managerial planning?

options.B: To prepare for the future

questions.question_text:
Corey wants a quality product that performs as it is supposed to. In other words, Corey is looking for an item 
that is

options.B: responsive.

questions.question_text: When an accident occurs at a place of business, employees should first try to

options.A: find out how serious it is.
options.B: take the victim's pulse.

questions.question_text:
Silas is unsure how to dress appropriately for his payroll manager job interview. Which of the following is a 
guideline that might help him select the proper attire:

options.A: Clothing types should follow current trends.
options.B: Patterns and textures of clothing should be contrasting.
options.C: Business clothing usually should be conservative.
options.D: Articles of clothing should have several points of focus.

questions.question_text: One of the benefits of orderly and systematic behavior is that it should help you to achieve

options.B: immediate success.

questions.question_text: Which of the following types of businesses is most likely to have high liability insurance costs:

options.B: A skydiving operation

questions.question_text: A high level of self-esteem can help individuals to

options.B: cope with criticism.

questions.question_text: It is good to feel empathy, but empathy is more beneficial to others if you know how to __________ it.

options.B: demand

questions.question_text: An important function of human resources management in business is

options.B: employee recruitment.

questions.question_text: Who typically pays payroll taxes?

options.B: Employers and employees

questions.question_text:
If the supply of a product decreases while demand remains the same, the price the consumer is charged for the 
product will probably

options.B: stabilize.

questions.question_text:
Maverick is the new manager of the accounting department. He plans to meet with each employee individually 
and ask them for feedback about his performance so that he can improve his weaknesses. Which of the 
following approaches is most likely to result in honest feedback from his staff:

options.A:
Maverick could admit a weakness that he is working on and ask if there are any other things he needs to 
improve.
options.B:
Maverick could anticipate concerns his employees are likely to have about his management style and 
prepare possible explanations.
options.C: Maverick could simply ask employees if they believe he is effectively leading the accounting department.
options.D: Maverick could ask his employees to compare his leadership with the leadership of the former department

questions.question_text: If you fail to assess the long-term value and impact of your actions on others, you are most likely to

options.B: limit others' personal growth.
options.C: become a better observer of the world around you.
options.D: have a negative impact on society.

questions.question_text:
Because the ILM Manufacturing Company orders large amounts of bolts and washers, the company's buyer 
asks its parts vendor for an additional 5% off the invoice total. This is an example of a business negotiating

options.B: a cash rebate.

questions.question_text:
A car manufacturer in Country A purchases parts from a factory in Country B. When Country B suffers a 
massive earthquake, the car manufacturer is forced to put production on hold until it can find another factory to 
supply the parts. What type of risk does this situation illustrate?

options.B: Environmental

questions.question_text: Which of the following is the primary activity performed during the execution phase of a project:

options.B: Producing

questions.question_text: Which of the following data change activities is considered a best practice:

options.A: Leaving an old system intact until its replacement is completely up and running
options.B: Only keeping one copy of all data and systems to reduce redundancy
options.C: Planning for data change processes to occur during normal business hours
options.D: Keeping data change processes hidden from employees until they are completed

questions.question_text: One possible downside to choosing overseas suppliers is

options.B: a simpler supply chain.

questions.question_text: A reason why being honest helps workers get along well with their coworkers is that honest workers

options.B: are more willing to share.

questions.question_text: What section of the statement of work (SOW) defines what the project will produce?

options.B: Purpose statement

questions.question_text: One of the primary goals of supply chain management is to

options.A: set prices for products that maximize profits.
options.B: control customer perceptions of a business.
options.C: minimize overall value to the customer.
options.D: gain a competitive advantage in the marketplace.

questions.question_text: Which of the following is a benefit of using mediation to resolve disputes:

options.B: Unbiased third-party decision maker

questions.question_text:
In Maria's community, the accumulation of wealth is a shared value that is often passed down from generation 
to generation. As a result, Maria is often attracted to luxury products. This is an example of a __________ 
influence on Maria's buying behavior.

options.B: situational

questions.question_text:
Thomas is reviewing job applications to determine the five most qualified candidates to interview for a sales 
position. What management activity is Thomas performing?

options.B: Training

questions.question_text: Effective headings in research reports are

options.B: lengthy.

questions.question_text: Which of the following is an example of technology supporting a business's knowledge management processes:

options.B: Tracking customer information in a customer relationship management system
options.C: Sending digital coupons through a third-party advertising service
options.D: Monitoring interactions on a business social media account

questions.question_text:
Because the company's president was impressed with Ed's willingness to accept additional tasks and carry 
them out without a lot of direction, they promoted Ed to a management position. What personal trait does Ed 
possess that helped him advance in his career?

options.B: Initiative

A manufacturing company would like to produce 5,000 finished products per day; however, the company cannot 
afford the machinery to do so. Instead, the firm decides to extend each employee's work day by one hour to 
make up for the lost production. This is an example of how __________ impact(s) business process design.

options.B: social norms

questions.question_text: Which of the following are examples of digital assets a business could own:

options.A: Logos, apps, and customer email lists
options.B: Websites, machinery, and subscriptions

questions.question_text: Which of the following is a type of insurance company in which the policyholders retain the profits:

options.B: Risk retention group

questions.question_text:
Effective change management has benefits on both the organizational and individual levels. A way in which it
